content:
Create Macros in Lightning Experience

To create a macro in Lightning Experience, use the Macro Builder—a point-and-click builder.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To view macros:	Read on macros
To create and edit macros:	Create AND Edit on macros
To create and run irreversible macros:	Manage Macros That Users Can’t Undo

To create a macro, open a record.
Click Macros in the utility bar.
NOTE If you see "This page doesn't support macros," check that you’re on the record page for a supported object. You can’t run macros on list views.
Click + or Create Macro.

Enter a name, description, folder, and select the object that the macro applies to.
Click Save.

The first instruction is added based on the object you selected from the Apply To field.
Click Edit Instructions.

The Macro Builder page opens. The left side of the page displays a canvas with a sample record page for the object you selected. The right side includes an Instructions tab and Details tab for your macro.

Click Add Logic to create logical expressions that evaluate a condition or a group of conditions, then add instructions that execute when the expression is true.
To add instructions that execute without evaluating any conditions, click Add Instruction on the bottom of the Instructions tab.

On the canvas, select a quick action. You can insert quick text, use email templates, add email attachments, create events with relative dates, and more.

Optionally, on the canvas, select a submit action to tell the macro to execute these instructions.
When you’re done with your macro, click Save.

To run your macro, open the Macro utility.
title: Creating Macros in Service Cloud
